pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:5.1: 69. The training rule on low seats
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.1: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.2: “How could the monks from the group of six sit on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.6: Foolish men, how can you sit on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:7.9: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.2: “At one time in Bārāṇasī, monks, there was a low-caste man whose wife became pregnant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.6: ‘There are no mangoes; it’s the wrong season.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.7: ‘If I don’t get any, I will die.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.8: At that time the king had a mango tree that was always bearing fruit.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.9: Then that low-caste man went to that mango tree, climbed it, and hid himself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.10: Just then the king and his brahmin counsellor went to that same mango tree. The king then sat on a high seat while learning mantras.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.12: ‘How wrong-headed this king is, in that he sits on a high seat while learning mantras.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.13: And the brahmin is wrong-headed too, in that he sits on a low seat while teaching the mantras to one sitting on a high seat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.14: And I’m wrong-headed too, in that I steal mangoes from the king because of a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:8.15: And he fell out of the tree right there.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:9.4: Not he who teaches the mantras,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:10.3: With a curry of pure meat:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:10.4: Therefore I’m not practicing the Teaching,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:10.5: The Teaching praised by the Noble Ones.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:11.2: ‘A curse it is the gaining of wealth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:11.3: And the gaining of fame, too, brahmin;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:11.4: These things come with a low rebirth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:12.2: Other beings will do the cooking;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:12.4: Because then you will break like a jar.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:13.1: Even at that time, monks, the teaching of mantras while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat was displeasing to me. How then could the giving of teachings in this way not be displeasing now?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:13.2: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:13.3: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:14.1: ‘“I will not give teachings while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick,” this is how you should train.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:15.1: One should not give teachings while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:15.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:16.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:16.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:17.1: The ninth training rule is finished.
